docs.lead_paragraph: We like to pigeonhole politicians. The ones who might run for president in 2016 don’t make that easy.
docs.snippet: We like to pigeonhole politicians. The ones who might run for president in 2016 don’t make that easy....
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column assesses what kind of Republican Jeb Bush is, in light of fact he may run for president in 2016; contends absence of clear answer is instructive; observes tussle to define Bush reflects way ideological yardsticks change over time and exposes poverty of political vocabulary.

headline.seo: Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and the 2016 Presidential Campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: Since grand juries in Missouri and New York declined to indict white police officers in the deaths of two black men, protesters nationwide have demanded a reckoning and an acknowledgment that "black lives matter."

docs.lead_paragraph: The counteroffensive, which includes a new website, began even before the Senate committee issued its report on the agency’s harsh treatment of detainees.

docs.abstract: Former Central Intelligence Agency Dir George J Tenet has been working for months with former CIA directors Porter Goss and Michael Hayden to rebut Senate Intelligence Committee's report on agency's interrogation tactics after 9/11 terrorist attacks; Tenet served from 1997 to 2004, under Presidents Bill Clinton and George W Bush, and led the agency in wake of 9/11 attacks during most intense phase of interrogations.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Chief Leads Vocal Defense of Spy Agency
headline.main: Ex-Chief Leads Vocal Defense of C.I.A.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fact that President Obama had to lobby his own party so intensely to avoid a government shutdown speaks to the challenge he faces in dealing with a hostile Congress.
docs.snippet: The fact that President Obama had to lobby his own party so intensely to avoid a government shutdown speaks to the challenge he faces in dealing with a hostile Congress....
docs.abstract: White House Memo; Pres Obama had to plead with his Democratic allies to pass $1.1 trillion spending bill in order to avoid another government shutdown, underscoring the challenge he faces in dealing with a hostile Congress.

headline.main: Obama’s Pleas Foreshadow Tense Relationship With a New Congress

docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has ruled out forcing New York Times reporter James Risen to divulge his source in the upcoming trial of a former CIA officer accused of disclosing government secrets, a person familiar with the matter said Friday night.

docs.lead_paragraph: Political realities have changed in recent decades.
docs.snippet: Political realities have changed in recent decades....
docs.abstract: The Upshot; Prof Brendan Nyhan questions when Americans will give up on idea of leader who will magically bring consensus and unity to politics; contends political system that enabled presidents to be uniting figures who work across the aisle to build support for their agenda is disappearing, and conditions that allowed for such a president were a historical anomaly.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 300 former campaign staffers and organizers for President Barack Obama have signed on to a letter urging Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren to run for president in 2016, the latest effort to nudge the Democrat into the race.
